dcterms:description: Learning from Play (LfP) provides an effective way of collecting task-agnostic, teleoperated, uncurated, freeform datasets consisting of rich, meaningful, multimodal interactions with the environment that cover different areas of the state space.
dcterms:title: Learning from Play (LfP)

dcterms:creator: Abhishek Gupta
Vikash Kumar
Corey Lynch
Sergey Levine
Karol Hausman
dcterms:description: Relay Kitchen is a multi-task kitchen environment with objects such as a kettle, door, and lights that the agent can interact with, consisting of human-collected trajectories with sequences of executed skills.
dcterms:title: Relay Kitchen

dcterms:creator: Pete Florence
Corey Lynch
Andy Zeng
Oscar A Ramirez
Ayzaan Wahid
Laura Downs
Adrian Wong
Johnny Lee
Igor Mordatch
Jonathan Tompson
dcterms:description: The Block-Push Environment consists of an XARm robot that must push two blocks into target areas, with a dataset of demonstrations collected by a deterministic controller.
dcterms:title: Block-Push Environment

dcterms:creator: Oier Mees
Lukas Hermann
Erick Rosete-Beas
Wolfram Burgard
dcterms:description: The CALVIN Benchmark is a benchmark for language-conditioned policy learning for long-horizon robot manipulation tasks, consisting of unstructured play data.
dcterms:title: CALVIN Benchmark
